Job Title: Transmission Right of Way Agent / Project Manager

Location: Tulsa, OK

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Integrated Talent Strategies (ITS) is seeking a Transmission Right of Way Agent / Project Manager in the Tulsa, OK area to work for a top utility and energy company. This position offers a variety of great benefits, including health insurance, 401(k), and paid time off.

This position is posted as a range. It is open to new graduates with a Bachelor’s degree. (Entry-level position in the job family). Pay dependent on qualifications and experience. Travel: approximately 10% to visit site locations. Valid driver’s license required. Hybrid position: on location three days per week; the remaining days will be remote. This position will start work on location. 

Job Summary: The successful candidate will oversee multiple projects or program area of projects within a matrix team environment related to the successful installation of transmission line and/or transmission station projects.

Responsibilities:

Manage and coordinate a Right of Way (ROW) portfolio of small - large transmission projects. Manage and direct right-of-way vendors comprised of non-direct reports of internal and contract resources. Provide guidance, coordination, instruction, and effective communications to initiate, plan, execute, monitor and control, and close projects in a safe, efficient and economical manner to achieve on time and within budget completion of projects. Provide leadership and direction and effectively communicate with all stakeholders, including internal customers, (engineering and other team members), external customers, regulatory and governmental agencies. Interface with project sponsors and build teams and kick off projects and bid and monitor progress on the projects to bring projects in on time and on budget. Monthly facilitation of meetings for status on construction and bidding along with creation and updating monthly project cost budgets and project schedules. 

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in real estate, business, engineering, project management or related applicable field. No experience necessary at the Associate Level. Minimum of two years of related experience at the Project Manager Level. Well-versed in various aspects of Project Management and/or Acquisition of ROW knowledge and skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Knowledgeable in GIS Mapping systems and databases. Knowledgeable in real estate values and accepted estimating practices. Knowledgeable in earned value and project reports. Valid driver’s license. 

About Integrated Talent Strategies (ITS):

ITS is an international recruiting and staffing firm specializing in Engineering, Technical and Professional positions. Founded in 1984 as a subsidiary of an engineering firm, ITS continues to remain a strategic partner for the job seeker.

Our clients include some of the largest and most respected architectural, engineering, and manufacturing companies in business today. Our ability to offer a wide range of services, and the flexibility to adjust to the changing needs of our clients, has allowed us to maintain a solid reputation for several decades.

Benefits include medical, dental, and vision insurance; 401(k) with a company match; paid holidays and vacations; tuition reimbursement. To learn more, go to www.wehirepeople.com or click below to directly contact your recruiter.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
